title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

The response must accurately describe the data.

For Task A, the response must identify the president who faced the fewest number of investigative hearing days in a single year when the House was controlled by the opposing party.

For Task B, the response must correctly describe the relationship between investigative hearing days and party control of the House and the presidency as shown in the bar graph.

For Task C, the response must correctly draw a conclusion about how the difference in congressional hearing days between 1970-1980 and 1990-2000 may have affected presidential power during those periods.

For Task D, the response must correctly explain whether the data in the bar graph for the years in which the president’s party controls the House reflect Madison’s ideas in The Federalist 51.

The point for each criterion is earned independently.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the prompt.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the prompt.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the prompt.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the prompt.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the prompt.
